FuncDef:
The bind ssl-policy command binds a Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) policy to a CUSP connection.
The undo bind ssl-policy command unbinds an SSL policy from a CUSP connection.
By default, no SSL policy is bound to a CUSP connection.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of an SSL policy.
The value is a string of 1 to 23 case-insensitive characters, spaces not supported.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
CUSP connections are insecure. To establish a secure SSL connection between the forwarding and control planes, run the bind ssl-policy command to bind an SSL policy to a CUSP connection.
Prerequisites
The CUSP forwarder view has been displayed by running the cusp agent command.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
